intro: Acriopsis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine acanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and umbellate inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural and traditional purposes.
